climbs.name: Refried Beans Me, Sour Cream Me
climbs.fa: Jonah Schriener, Mike Kirschbaum, Justin Streit, Joshua Gale 1.15.15

content.description: Sit start and traverse the rightward rising rail, using heel hooks and such. Top out.
content.location: North east by about 30ft. of Dusty Taco. Just adjacent to the formation that everything else is on.

climbs.name: Mexican Jacket
climbs.fa: Justin Streit, Mike Kirschbaum, Jonah Schriener, Joshua Gale 1.15.15

content.description: You'll be climbing the beautifully tiger striped wall, right of the sharp arÃªte, that is both concave and angular. The rock is perfect on this one. Stand start matched with a crimp rail at chest/head height in the concave and feet smearing. Move the left hand up over the roof onto a vertical crimp and begin a series of contortionist movements that have you palming out right, high stepping, body scumming and bumping through some edges. Top out directly through the looming Aron Ralston boulders. They seem solid!
content.location: 20 ft. to climber's right of Dusty Taco.

climbs.name: Dusty Taco
climbs.fa: Justin Streit, Mike Kirschbaum, Jonah Schriener, Joshua Gale 1.15.15

content.description: The finger and handcrack in the corner. Sit start in the crack. Top out.
content.location: Head north from Burrito Face-Plant about 60ft and turn left. Dusty Taco is the obvious dihedral on the same formation.

climbs.name: Burrito Face-Plant
climbs.fa: Mike Kirschbaum, Justin Streit, Jonah Schriener, Joshua Gale 1.15.15

content.description: Big moves, finger locks, jugs, slopers and crimps. This mini route is action packed and has it all.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a bolted anchor. Stick clip or stand on the rock pile to hang the first draw. Begin the actual climbing down and left of the first bolt on a jug under the roof. Using a single carabiner on the 2nd bolt is recommended.
content.location: The only bolted line on the cliff.

climbs.name: Amigos' Arete
climbs.fa: Justin Streit, Matt Schook, Lukas Jordan, Joshua Gale 3.29.15

content.description: Stand start with crimps at head height (maybe a little higher), left of the obvious crimp rail start of Mexican Jacket. The left hand starting crimp, is on the actual arete. Climb the arete. Use the ledge at top to hand traverse leftwards and top out.
content.location: The obvious arete between Dusty Taco and Mexican Jacket.

content.description: This is a small cliff that sits at about a 5 minute walk from the Salt Factory. It houses 1 bolted route and a handful of boulder problems.
